a request to the [UpdateCustomer](#endpoint-updatecustomer) endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

modifier_lists_to_enable.description: The set of [CatalogModifierList](#type-catalogmodifierlist)s (referenced by ID) to enable for the [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem).

modifier_lists_to_disable.description: The set of [CatalogModifierList](#type-catalogmodifierlist)s (referenced by ID) to disable for the [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem).

errors.description: The set of [Error](#type-error)s encountered.

updated_at.description: The database [timestamp](#workingwithdates) of this update in RFC 3339 format, e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

item_ids.description: The [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem)s whose enabled/disabled [CatalogTax](#type-catalogtax)es are being updated.

taxes_to_enable.description: The set of [CatalogTax](#type-catalogtax)es (referenced by ID) to enable for the [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem).

taxes_to_disable.description: The set of [CatalogTax](#type-catalogtax)es (referenced by ID) to disable for the [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem).

errors.description: The set of [Error](#type-error)s encountered.

updated_at.description: The database [timestamp](#workingwithdates) of this update in RFC 3339 format, e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this
request among all your requests. A common way to create
a valid idempotency key is to use a Universally unique
identifier (UUID).

If you're unsure whether a particular request was successful,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about creating duplicate objects.

See [Idempotency keys](#idempotencykeys) for more information.

object.description:
A [CatalogObject](#type-catalogobject) to be created or updated. The object's `is_deleted` field must not
be set to `true`. When creating a new object, the object's ID must either start with a `#` character or be left
blank. In either case it will be replaced with a server-generated ID.

errors.description: The set of [Error](#type-error)s encountered.

id_mappings.description: The mapping between client and server IDs for this Upsert.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

VoidTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the [CaptureTransaction](#endpoint-capturetransaction) endpoint.

amount.description:
Amount in the lowest denominated value of this Currency. E.g. in USD
these are cents, in JPY they are Yen (which do not have a 'cent' concept).

calling_code.description: The phone number's international calling code. For US phone numbers, this value is +1.

name.description: The name associated with the merchant account.

email.description: The email address associated with the merchant account.

account_type.description: Indicates whether the merchant account corresponds to a single-location account (LOCATION) or a business account (BUSINESS). This value is almost always LOCATION.

account_capabilities.description: Capabilities that are enabled for the merchant's Square account. Capabilities that are not listed in this array are not enabled for the account.

country_code.description: The country associated with the merchant account, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

language_code.description: The language associated with the merchant account, in BCP 47 format.

currency_code.description: The currency associated with the merchant account, in ISO 4217 format. For example, the currency code for US dollars is USD.

business_name.description: The name of the merchant's business.

business_address.description: The address of the merchant's business.

business_phone.description: The phone number of the merchant's business.

business_type.description: The type of business operated by the merchant.

nickname.description: The nickname assigned to the single-location account by the parent business. This value appears in the parent business's multi-location dashboard.

location_details.description: Additional information for a single-location account specified by its associated business account, if it has one.

market_url.description: The URL of the merchant's online store.

v1Merchant.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **RetrieveBusiness** endpoint.

v1Employee.description: Represents one of a business's employees.

role_ids.description: The ids of the employee's associated roles. Currently, you can specify only one or zero roles per employee.

authorized_location_ids.description: The IDs of the locations the employee is allowed to clock in at.

status.description: CWhether the employee is ACTIVE or INACTIVE. Inactive employees cannot sign in to Square Register.Merchants update this field from the Square Dashboard.

external_id.description: An ID the merchant can set to associate the employee with an entity in another system.

created_at.description: The time when the employee entity was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the employee entity was most recently updated, in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: The role's unique ID, Can only be set by Square.

is_owner.description: If true, employees with this role have all permissions, regardless of the values indicated in permissions.

created_at.description: The time when the employee entity was created, in ISO 8601 format. Is set by Square when the Role is created.

updated_at.description: The time when the employee entity was most recently updated, in ISO 8601 format. Is set by Square when the Role updated.

v1Timecard.description: Represents a timecard for an employee.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee the timecard is associated with.

deleted.description: If true, the timecard was deleted by the merchant, and it is no longer valid.

clockin_time.description: The clock-in time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The clock-out time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

clockin_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked in from, if any.

clockout_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked out from. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

created_at.description: The time when the timecard was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the timecard was most recently updated, in ISO 8601 format.

event_type.description: The ID of the timecard to list events for.

clockin_time.description: The time the employee clocked in, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The time the employee clocked out, in ISO 8601 format.

created_at.description: The time when the event was created, in ISO 8601 format.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that created the event.

event_type.description: The type of event that occurred.

event_money.description: The amount of money that was added to or removed from the cash drawer because of the event. This value can be positive (for added money) or negative (for removed money).

created_at.description: The time when the event occurred, in ISO 8601 format.

description.description: An optional description of the event, entered by the employee that created it.

opened_at.description: The time when the shift began, in ISO 8601 format.

ended_at.description: The time when the shift ended, in ISO 8601 format.

closed_at.description: The time when the shift was closed, in ISO 8601 format.

employee_ids.description: The IDs of all employees that were logged into Square Register at some point during the cash drawer shift.

opening_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that started the cash drawer shift.

ending_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that ended the cash drawer shift.

closing_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that closed the cash drawer shift by auditing the cash drawer's contents.

description.description: The time when the timecard was created, in ISO 8601 format.

starting_cash_money.description: The amount of money in the cash drawer at the start of the shift.

cash_payment_money.description: The amount of money added to the cash drawer from cash payments.

cash_refunds_money.description: The amount of money removed from the cash drawer from cash refunds. This value is always negative or zero.

cash_paid_in_money.description: The amount of money added to the cash drawer for reasons other than cash payments.

cash_paid_out_money.description: The amount of money removed from the cash drawer for reasons other than cash refunds.

expected_cash_money.description: The amount of money that should be in the cash drawer at the end of the shift, based on the shift's other money amounts.

closed_cash_money.description: The amount of money found in the cash drawer at the end of the shift by an auditing employee.

device.description: The device running Square Register that was connected to the cash drawer.

events.description: All of the events (payments, refunds, and so on) that involved the cash drawer during the shift.

merchant_id.description: The unique identifier of the merchant that took the payment.

created_at.description: The time when the payment was created, in ISO 8601 format.

creator_id.description: The unique identifier of the Square account that took the payment.

device.description: The device that took the payment.

payment_url.description: The URL of the payment's detail page in the merchant dashboard. The merchant must be signed in to the merchant dashboard to view this page.

receipt_url.description: The URL of the receipt for the payment. Note that for split tender payments, this URL corresponds to the receipt for the first tender listed in the payment's tender field. Each Tender object has its own receipt_url field you can use to get the other receipts associated with a split tender payment.

inclusive_tax_money.description: The sum of all inclusive taxes associated with the payment.

additive_tax_money.description: The sum of all additive taxes associated with the payment.

tax_money.description: The total of all taxes applied to the payment. This is always the sum of inclusive_tax_money and additive_tax_money.

tip_money.description: The total of all tips applied to the payment.

discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the payment.

total_collected_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the payment.

processing_fee_money.description: The total of all processing fees collected by Square for the payment.

net_total_money.description: The amount to be deposited into the merchant's bank account for the payment.

refunded_money.description: The total of all refunds applied to the payment.

inclusive_tax.description: All of the inclusive taxes associated with the payment.

additive_tax.description: All of the additive taxes associated with the payment.

tender.description: All of the additive taxes associated with the payment.

refunds.description: All of the refunds applied to the payment.

itemizations.description: The items purchased in the payment.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item purchased. This can be a decimal value.

itemization_type.description: The type of purchase that the itemization represents, such as an ITEM or CUSTOM_AMOUNT

item_detail.description: Details of the item, including its unique identifier and the identifier of the item variation purchased.

notes.description: Notes entered by the merchant about the item at the time of payment, if any.

item_variation_name.description: The name of the item variation purchased, if any.

total_money.description: The total cost of the item, including all taxes and discounts.

single_quantity_money.description: The cost of a single unit of this item.

gross_sales_money.description: The total cost of the itemization and its modifiers, not including taxes or discounts.

discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the itemization. This value is always negative or zero.

net_sales_money.description: The sum of gross_sales_money and discount_money.

taxes.description: All taxes applied to this itemization.

discounts.description: All discounts applied to this itemization.

modifiers.description: All modifier options applied to this itemization.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this modifier option adds to the payment.

modifier_option_id.description: TThe ID of the applied modifier option, if available. Modifier options applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this discount adds to the payment (note that this value is always negative or zero).

discount_id.description: The ID of the applied discount, if available. Discounts applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

category_name.description: The name of the item's merchant-defined category, if any.

sku.description: The item's merchant-defined SKU, if any.

item_id.description: The unique ID of the item purchased, if any.

item_variation_id.description: The unique ID of the item variation purchased, if any.

reason.description: The merchant-specified reason for the refund.

refunded_money.description: The amount of money refunded. This amount is always negative.

created_at.description: The time when the merchant initiated the refund for Square to process, in ISO 8601 format..

processed_at.description: The time when Square processed the refund on behalf of the merchant, in ISO 8601 format.

payment_id.description: The Square-issued ID of the payment the refund is applied to.

total_money.description: The amount of money involved in the settlement. A positive amount indicates a deposit, and a negative amount indicates a withdrawal. This amount is never zero.

initiated_at.description: The time when the settlement was submitted for deposit or withdrawal, in ISO 8601 format.

bank_account_id.description: The Square-issued unique identifier for the bank account associated with the settlement.

entries.description: The entries included in this settlement.

amount_money.description: The total amount of money this entry contributes to the total settlement amount.

fee_money.description: The amount of all Square fees associated with this settlement entry. This value is always negative or zero.

name.description: A human-readable description of the tender.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that processed the tender.

receipt_url.description: The URL of the receipt for the tender.

card_brand.description: The brand of credit card provided.

pan_suffix.description: The last four digits of the provided credit card's account number.

payment_note.description: Notes entered by the merchant about the tender at the time of payment, if any. Typically only present for tender with the type: OTHER.

total_money.description: The total amount of money provided in this form of tender.

tendered_money.description: The amount of total_money applied to the payment.

change_back_money.description: The amount of total_money returned to the buyer as change.

refunded_money.description: The total of all refunds applied to this tender. This amount is always negative or zero.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

name.description: The merchant-defined name of the tax.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this tax adds to the payment.

rate.description: The rate of the tax, as a string representation of a decimal number. A value of 0.07 corresponds to a rate of 7%.

inclusion_type.description: Whether the tax is an ADDITIVE tax or an INCLUSIVE tax.

fee_id.description: The ID of the tax, if available. Taxes applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

buyer_email.description: The email address of the order's buyer.

recipient_name.description: The name of the order's buyer.

recipient_phone_number.description: The phone number to use for the order's delivery.

state.description: Whether the tax is an ADDITIVE tax or an INCLUSIVE tax.

shipping_address.description: The address to ship the order to.

subtotal_money.description: The amount of all items purchased in the order, before taxes and shipping.

total_shipping_money.description: The shipping cost for the order.

total_tax_money.description: The total of all taxes applied to the order.

total_price_money.description: The total cost of the order.

total_discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the order.

created_at.description: The time when the order was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the order was last modified, in ISO 8601 format.

expires_at.description: The time when the order expires if no action is taken, in ISO 8601 format.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment associated with the order.

buyer_note.description: A note provided by the buyer when the order was created, if any.

completed_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to COMPLETED, if any

refunded_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to REFUNDED, if any.

canceled_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to CANCELED, if any.

tender.description: The tender used to pay for the order.

order_history.description: The history of actions associated with the order.

promo_code.description: The promo code provided by the buyer, if any.

btc_receive_address.description: For Bitcoin transactions, the address that the buyer sent Bitcoin to.

btc_price_satoshi.description: For Bitcoin transactions, the price of the buyer's order in satoshi (100 million satoshi equals 1 BTC).

action.description: The type of action performed on the order.

created_at.description: The time when the action was performed, in ISO 8601 format.

merchant_id.description: The Square-issued ID of the merchant associated with the bank account.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank that manages the account.

name.description: The name associated with the bank account.

account_number_suffix.description: The last few digits of the bank account number.

currency_code.description: The currency code of the currency associated with the bank account, in ISO 4217 format. For example, the currency code for US dollars is USD.

type.description: The bank account's type (for example, savings or checking).

item_id.description: The ID of the variation's associated item.

ordinal.description: Indicates the variation's list position when displayed in Square Register and the merchant dashboard. If more than one variation for the same item has the same ordinal value, those variations are displayed in alphabetical order

pricing_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation's price is fixed or determined at the time of sale.

price_money.description: The item variation's price, if any.

sku.description: The item variation's SKU, if any.

track_inventory.description: If true, inventory tracking is active for the variation.

inventory_alert_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation displays an alert when its inventory quantity is less than or equal to its inventory_alert_threshold.

inventory_alert_threshold.description: If the inventory quantity for the variation is less than or equal to this value and inventory_alert_type is LOW_QUANTITY, the variation displays an alert in the merchant dashboard.

user_data.description: Arbitrary metadata associated with the variation. Cannot exceed 255 characters.

id.description: The item's ID. Must be unique among all entity IDs ever provided on behalf of the merchant. You can never reuse an ID. This value can include alphanumeric characters, dashes (-), and underscores (_).

type.description: The item's type. This value is NORMAL for almost all items.

color.description: The color of the discount's display label in Square Register, if not the default color. The default color is 9da2a6.

abbreviation.description: The text of the item's display label in Square Register. Only up to the first five characters of the string are used.

visibility.description: Indicates whether the item is viewable from the merchant's online store (PUBLIC) or PRIVATE.

available_online.description: If true, the item can be added to shipping orders from the merchant's online store.

master_image.description: The item's master image, if any.

category.description: The category the item belongs to, if any.

variations.description: The item's variations. You must specify at least one variation.

modifier_lists.description: The modifier lists that apply to the item, if any.

fees.description: The fees that apply to the item, if any.

taxable.description: Deprecated. This field is not used.

rate.description: The rate of the fee, as a string representation of a decimal number. A value of 0.07 corresponds to a rate of 7%.

adjustment_type.description: The type of adjustment the fee applies to a payment. Currently, this value is TAX for all fees.

applies_to_custom_amounts.description: If true, the fee applies to custom amounts entered into Square Register that are not associated with a particular item.

enabled.description: If true, the fee is applied to all appropriate items. If false, the fee is not applied at all.

inclusion_type.description: Whether the fee is ADDITIVE or INCLUSIVE.

type.description: In countries with multiple classifications for sales taxes, indicates which classification the fee falls under. Currently relevant only to Canadian merchants.

selection_type.description: Indicates whether MULTIPLE options or a SINGLE option from the modifier list can be applied to a single item.

modifier_options.description: The options included in the modifier list.

on_by_default.description: If true, the modifier option is the default option in a modifier list for which selection_type is SINGLE.

ordinal.description: Indicates the modifier option's list position when displayed in Square Register and the merchant dashboard. If more than one modifier option in the same modifier list has the same ordinal value, those options are displayed in alphabetical order.

modifier_list_id.description: The ID of the modifier list the option belongs to.

variation_id.description: The variation that the entry corresponds to.

quantity_on_hand.description: The current available quantity of the item variation.

quantity_delta.description: The number to adjust the variation's quantity by.

adjustment_type.description: The reason for the inventory adjustment.

memo.description: A note about the inventory adjustment.

rate.description: The rate of the discount, as a string representation of a decimal number. A value of 0.07 corresponds to a rate of 7%. This rate is 0 if discount_type is VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE.

amount_money.description: The amount of the discount. This amount is 0 if discount_type is VARIABLE_AMOUNT. This field is not included for rate-based discounts.

discount_type.description: Indicates whether the discount is a FIXED value or entered at the time of sale.

pin_required.description: Indicates whether a mobile staff member needs to enter their PIN to apply the discount to a payment.

color.description: The color of the discount's display label in Square Register, if not the default color. The default color is 9da2a6.

page_index.description: The page's position in the merchant's list of pages. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

cells.description: The cells included on the page.

page_id.description: The unique identifier of the page the cell is included on.

row.description: The row of the cell. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

column.description: The column of the cell. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

object_type.description: The type of entity represented in the cell (ITEM, DISCOUNT, CATEGORY, or PLACEHOLDER).

object_id.description: The unique identifier of the entity represented in the cell. Not present for cells with an object_type of PLACEHOLDER.

placeholder_type.description: For a cell with an object_type of PLACEHOLDER, this value indicates the cell's special behavior.

payment_id.description: The ID of the payment to refund. If you're creating a PARTIAL refund for a split tender payment, instead provide the id of the particular tender you want to refund. See Split Tender Payments for details.

type.description: TThe type of refund (FULL or PARTIAL).

refunded_money.description: The amount of money to refund. Required only for PARTIAL refunds.

request_idempotence_key.description: An optional key to ensure idempotence if you issue the same PARTIAL refund request more than once.

action.description: The action to perform on the order (COMPLETE, CANCEL, or REFUND).

shipped_tracking_number.description: The tracking number of the shipment associated with the order. Only valid if action is COMPLETE.

completed_note.description: A merchant-specified note about the completion of the order. Only valid if action is COMPLETE.

refunded_note.description: A merchant-specified note about the refunding of the order. Only valid if action is REFUND.

canceled_note.description: A merchant-specified note about the canceling of the order. Only valid if action is CANCEL.

selection_type.description: Indicates whether multiple options from the modifier list can be applied to a single item.
